paragraph.text: “Provide plumbing services” includes installing, repairing, servicing, and replacing gas piping, gas utilization equipment, and associated accessories.

Except for the first connection to a potable water supply that is downstream of a backflow preventer and the final connection that discharges indirectly into a public or private disposal system, sanitary drainage facility, or storm drainage facility, “providing plumbing services” does not include using piping, equipment, or material only for:

subparagraph.text: environmental control;
the incorporation of a liquid or gas into a product or into a process, including product development, in the manufacture or storage of a product;
the installation, alteration, repair, or removal of an automatic sprinkler system, related apparatus, or standpipe that is used only for fire protection; or
an overhead or underground fire line beginning from where water is used only for fire protection.

subsection.text: “Provide propane gas services” means to install, repair, service, and replace propane gas piping, propane gas utilization equipment, and associated accessories.
“State Plumbing Code” means the regulations adopted by the Secretary, as amended by the Board, to provide standards that:

paragraph.text: are based on principles of environmental sanitation and safety; and
provide for properly designed, acceptably installed, and adequately maintained plumbing systems.

subsection.text: “Weighted average lead content” means a calculation determined by:

paragraph.text: identifying each component of a pipe, pipe fitting, plumbing fitting, or fixture that water flows through and comes into contact with during normal operation;
identifying the percentage of lead content of each component of the pipe, pipe fitting, plumbing fitting, or fixture;
determining the wetted surface area of each component of the pipe, pipe fitting, plumbing fitting, or fixture;
determining the percent of total wetted surface area of the pipe, pipe fitting, plumbing fitting, or fixture, represented in each component;

calculating the contributing percent lead for each component that comes into contact with water by multiplying the percentage of lead content of the component by the percent of total wetted surface area represented by the component; and
calculating the sum of each contributing percent lead value determined for each component under item (5) of this subsection.

section.text: The purposes of this title are to:

paragraph.text: protect the integrity of the potable water supply;
provide for the efficient and safe discharge of storm drainage and sanitary drainage; and
ensure that qualified individuals carry out items (1) and (2) of this section.

subsection.text: Except as expressly provided in §§ 12-305 and 12-307 of this title, this title does not apply to Baltimore County.

Except as expressly provided in §§ 12-305 and 12-307 of this title, this title does not apply to areas of Montgomery and Prince George’s counties that are under the jurisdiction of the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission.

section.text: This title does not limit the right of an individual to practice well drilling if the individual is licensed or otherwise authorized under Title 13 of the Environment Article to practice well drilling.
There is a State Board of Plumbing in the Department.

paragraph.text: The Board consists of 9 members.
Of the 9 members of the Board:

subparagraph.text: 7 shall be plumbers; and
2 shall be consumer members.

paragraph.text: Of the 7 plumber members of the Board:

subparagraph.text: at least 6 shall be master plumbers; and
1 may be a journey plumber or a master plumber.

paragraph.text: Subject to paragraph (6) of this subsection, of the 7 plumber members of the Board:

subparagraph.text: 2 shall be from Baltimore City;
1 shall be from the area that consists of Anne Arundel, Calvert, Charles, Prince George’s, and St. Mary’s counties;
1 shall be from the area that consists of Caroline, Dorchester, Kent, Queen Anne’s, Somerset, Talbot, Wicomico, and Worcester counties;
1 shall be from the area that consists of Allegany, Frederick, Garrett, Montgomery, and Washington counties; and
2 shall be from the area that consists of Carroll, Cecil, Harford, and Howard counties.

paragraph.text: A consumer member may not reside in the same county as a plumber member.
A member may not reside in a county or area of a county that is exempted from this title.
The Governor shall appoint the members with the advice of the Secretary and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

subsection.text: Each consumer member of the Board:

paragraph.text: shall be a member of the general public;
may not be a licensee or otherwise be subject to regulation by the Board;
may not be required to meet the qualifications for the professional members of the Board; and
may not, within 1 year before appointment, have had a financial interest in or have received compensation from a person regulated by the Board.

subsection.text: While a member of the Board, a consumer member may not:

paragraph.text: have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Board; or
grade an examination given by or for the Board.

subsection.text: Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

paragraph.text: The term of a member is 3 years and begins on May 1.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 1989.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

subsection.text: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.

section.caption: ** TAKES EFFECT MAY 1, 2013 PER CHAPTER 122 OF 2012 **

paragraph.text: The Board consists of 9 members.
Of the 9 members of the Board:

subparagraph.text: 7 shall be plumbers; and
2 shall be consumer members.

paragraph.text: Of the 7 plumber members of the Board:

subparagraph.text: at least 6 shall be master plumbers; and
1 may be a journey plumber or a master plumber.

paragraph.text: Subject to paragraph (6) of this subsection, of the 7 plumber members of the Board:

subparagraph.text: 2 shall be from Baltimore City;
1 shall be from the area that consists of Anne Arundel, Calvert, Charles, Prince George’s, and St. Mary’s counties;
1 shall be from the area that consists of Caroline, Dorchester, Kent, Queen Anne’s, Somerset, Talbot, Wicomico, and Worcester counties;
1 shall be from the area that consists of Allegany, Frederick, Garrett, Montgomery, and Washington counties;
1 shall be from the area that consists of Carroll and Howard counties; and
1 shall be from the area that consists of Cecil and Harford counties.

paragraph.text: A consumer member may not reside in the same county as a plumber member.
A member may not reside in a county or area of a county that is exempted from this title.
The Governor shall appoint the members with the advice of the Secretary and with the advice and consent of the Senate.

subsection.text: Each consumer member of the Board:

paragraph.text: shall be a member of the general public;
may not be a licensee or otherwise be subject to regulation by the Board;
may not be required to meet the qualifications for the professional members of the Board; and
may not, within 1 year before appointment, have had a financial interest in or have received compensation from a person regulated by the Board.

subsection.text: While a member of the Board, a consumer member may not:

paragraph.text: have a financial interest in or receive compensation from a person regulated by the Board; or
grade an examination given by or for the Board.

subsection.text: Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

paragraph.text: The term of a member is 3 years and begins on May 1.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 1989.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

subsection.text: The Governor may remove a member for incompetence or misconduct.
From among the members of the Board and with the advice of the Secretary, the Governor shall appoint a chairman.
Except for the chairman, the manner of election of officers and their terms of office shall be as the Board determines.
A majority of the members then serving on the Board is a quorum.
The Board shall determine the times and places of its meetings.
Subject to the State budget, each member of the Board is entitled to:

paragraph.text: an annual salary of $3,600; and
reimbursement for reasonable expenses under the Standard State Travel Regulations.

subsection.text: The Board may employ a staff in accordance with the State budget.
The Board may adopt regulations to amend the State Plumbing Code.

paragraph.text: The Board may adopt, as part of the State Plumbing Code, regulations to carry out the purposes of and to enforce §§ 12–605 and 12–606 of this title.
The Board may adopt standards of the American National Standards Institute or any other nationally recognized organization.
The Board shall adopt, as part of the State Plumbing Code, regulations to carry out the purposes of and to enforce §§ 12–605.1 and 12–605.2 of this title.
At least once a year, the Board shall review:

subparagraph.text: new and existing standards of the American National Standards Institute and any other organization listed in the State Plumbing Code or the Model Performance Building Code for water conserving appliances, devices, fittings, and fixtures; and
the availability and cost of water conserving appliances, devices, fittings, and fixtures that conform to the standards.

paragraph.text: If the Board finds that a water conserving appliance, device, fitting, or fixture that conforms to the standards of the American National Standards Institute or any other organization listed in the State Plumbing Code or the Model Performance Building Code is readily available at reasonable cost, the Board shall amend the State Plumbing Code to:

subparagraph.text: incorporate the standards for and require use of the water conserving appliance, device, fitting, or fixture; and

require the use of a water supply system and a drainage and venting system that are designed based on the hydraulic requirements of the required water conserving appliances, devices, fittings, and fixtures.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding the availability and cost of the appliance, device, fitting, or fixture, the Board may allow, under the State Plumbing Code, the installation of a water conserving appliance, device, fitting, or fixture that meets the standards of the American National Standards Institute or any other organization listed in the State Plumbing Code or the Model Performance Building Code, subject to the use of a water supply system and a venting and drainage system design based on the hydraulic requirements of the appliance, device, fitting, or fixture.

On or before July 1 of each year and subject to § 2–1246 of the State Government Article, the Board shall submit to the General Assembly a written report on the implementation of this subsection, including the results of the review conducted under this subsection.

subsection.text: The Board shall:

paragraph.text: periodically publish an updated version of the State Plumbing Code; and
make available on request of any person a copy of the State Plumbing Code for a reasonable fee.

subsection.text: A county shall:

paragraph.text: enforce the State Plumbing Code; or

adopt and enforce a local plumbing code that meets or exceeds the minimum standards of the State Plumbing Code for the proper design, acceptable installation, and adequate maintenance of plumbing systems.
In this subsection:

subparagraph.text: “greywater” means used, untreated water generated by:

sub-subparagraph.text: a clothes washing machine;
a shower; or
a bathtub; and

subparagraph.text: “greywater” does not include water from:

sub-subparagraph.text: a toilet;
a kitchen sink; or
a dishwashing machine.

paragraph.text: A county may not adopt or enforce a provision of a local plumbing code that prohibits a system that recycles greywater, as authorized under the State Plumbing Code.

subsection.text: Unless the Board determines that a county is adequately enforcing the State Plumbing Code or a local plumbing code that meets or exceeds the minimum standards of the State Plumbing Code, the Board shall enforce the State Plumbing Code in that county.
The Board may make a cooperative agreement with a county for the county to enforce:

paragraph.text: the State Plumbing Code; or
if the county has adopted a local plumbing code, that code.

subsection.text: In addition to any powers set forth elsewhere, the Board may adopt regulations to carry out the provisions of this title.
In addition to any duties set forth elsewhere, the Board shall enforce the provisions of this title.
The Board may conduct investigations into and, subject to the State budget, may employ an investigative staff to investigate any complaint that alleges facts that constitute:

paragraph.text: a ground for disciplinary action under § 12-312 of this title; or
a violation of this title.
On receipt of the results of an investigation made under this section, the Board promptly shall take the action that is appropriate under this title to ensure compliance with this title.

If a complaint is made to the Board from a county, municipal corporation, or unit of the State government, the Board reasonably and promptly shall give the county, municipal corporation, or unit notice of the action taken.

If the Board concludes that conduct alleged to be a violation of this title may result in irreparable harm to any person, the Board may sue to enforce any provision of this title by ex parte, interlocutory, or final injunction.
In seeking an injunction under this subsection, the Board need not:

subparagraph.text: post bond, if the injunction is sought against a person who does not hold a license issued under this title; or
allege or prove that an adequate remedy at law does not exist.

paragraph.text: The Board shall bring suit under this subsection in the circuit court for the county where:

subparagraph.text: the violation allegedly is occurring;
the principal place of business of the alleged violator is located; or
the alleged violator resides.

section.text: The Board shall pay all money collected under this title into the General Fund of the State.
The Board exercises its powers, duties, and functions subject to the authority of the Secretary.

paragraph.text: Except as otherwise provided in this title, an individual shall be licensed by the Board to provide plumbing services before the individual may provide plumbing services in the State.

Except as otherwise provided in this title, an individual shall be licensed by the Board to provide or to assist in providing plumbing services before the individual may assist in providing plumbing services in the State.

Except as otherwise provided in this title, an individual shall be licensed by the Board to provide plumbing services or certified by the Board to provide propane gas services before the individual may provide propane gas services in the State.
Except as otherwise provided in this title, an individual shall be licensed by the Board to provide natural gas services before the individual may provide natural gas services in the State.
Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, this section does not apply to an individual who personally provides plumbing services in the residence of the individual.
An individual may not provide plumbing services that make a final connection between the residence of the individual and a public or private disposal system or water supply system.

subsection.text: This section does not apply to an employee of a gas company regulated by the Public Service Commission while making a connection to a gas appliance for domestic purposes or while installing, repairing, maintaining, replacing, or performing any other work on a natural gas, propane gas, or other gas distribution system, including customer-owned gas piping systems.
This section does not apply to an individual performing work that is only incidental to the licensee providing or assisting in providing plumbing services.
This section does not apply to an individual who, without compensation, provides plumbing services that the Board defines by regulation to be only incidental plumbing services.

This section does not apply to an employee of a building owner, manager, or maintenance company who provides plumbing services that the Board defines by regulation to be only minor plumbing repair services.

This section does not apply to an individual who is licensed as an appliance installer in Allegany County, Frederick County, Garrett County, or Washington County while acting within the scope of the license.

This section does not apply to an individual who is licensed in Washington County to work as or for a septic system installer or an on-site utility contractor installing water or sewer service in the county at least 5 feet from a building being served.

Subsection (a)(3) and (4) of this section does not apply to an individual licensed by the State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors while servicing an existing propane gas or existing natural gas appliance if the individual has completed a manufacturer’s training course certifying competence to work on that particular type of appliance.
In this section, “licensed master plumber” means an individual who holds:

paragraph.text: a master plumber license or a limited master plumber license issued by the Board;
a master plumber license issued by the Baltimore County Plumbing Board;
a master plumber license issued by the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission; or

a master plumber license issued by another state, if the individual became licensed in that state after passing an examination that is equivalent to the examination for a master plumber license given in this State.

subsection.text: To qualify for a license, an applicant shall be an individual who meets the requirements of this section.

paragraph.text: An applicant for a journey plumber license:

sub-subparagraph.text: shall have held, for a period of at least 4 years, an apprentice plumber license or a license of equal stature, as determined by the Board, that is issued by another state; and
during that period, shall have completed at least 7,500 hours of training in providing plumbing services under the direction and control of a licensed master plumber; and

subparagraph.text: shall have completed at least 32 hours of training in the testing of backflow prevention devices, in a manner approved by the Board.

paragraph.text: The Board may allow the applicant to apply up to 1,500 hours of accredited, approved school study toward the experience requirement of paragraph (1)(i)2 of this subsection.

subsection.text: An applicant for a master plumber license:

paragraph.text: shall have completed at least 3,750 hours of training in providing plumbing services as a journey plumber licensed in this State or another state and under the direction and control of a licensed master plumber;

subparagraph.text: if an applicant resides in this State, shall have a journey plumber license for at least 2 years; or
shall have been licensed in another state as a journey plumber after:

sub-subparagraph.text: completing at least 7,500 hours of training in providing plumbing services under the direction and control of a licensed master plumber; and
passing a written examination that is equivalent to the examination for a journey plumber license given in this State; and

paragraph.text: shall have completed at least 32 hours of training in the testing of backflow prevention devices, in a manner approved by the Board.

subsection.text: Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, an applicant for a master plumber license or a journey plumber license shall pass an examination given by the Board under this subtitle.
An applicant for a propane gas fitter certificate shall:

paragraph.text: hold a current certification of completion of the National Propane Gas Association Certified Training Program for Distribution Systems Operations;

hold a gas fitters license from a county or municipal corporation authorizing the individual to provide propane gas services under a licensing program that is in existence prior to July 1, 1995 and that is acceptable to the Board; or

otherwise demonstrate qualifications that are satisfactory to the Board and that are at least equivalent to the qualifications required by the National Propane Gas Association Certified Training Program for Distribution Systems Operations.
An applicant for a journeyman natural gas fitters license:

subparagraph.text: shall have acquired 3,750 working hours as an apprentice natural gas fitter over a period of at least 2 years; and
shall have demonstrated successful completion of a training course approved by the Board relating to natural gas services.

paragraph.text: Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, an applicant for a journeyman natural gas fitters license shall pass an examination given by the Board under this subtitle.

subsection.text: An applicant for a master natural gas fitters license shall:

paragraph.text: hold a gas fitters license from a county or municipal corporation authorizing the individual to provide natural gas services under a licensing program that is in existence prior to July 1, 1999, is acceptable to the Board, and at a minimum requires:

subparagraph.text: successful completion of the licensing examination with a passing score of no less than 70; and
2 years of work experience as a journeyman natural gas fitter under the direction of a:

sub-subparagraph.text: licensed master plumber; or
licensed master gas fitter;

paragraph.text: apply to the Board for a master natural gas fitters license before October 1, 2002 and provide proof that:

subparagraph.text: the applicant has completed a natural gas certification program offered by a third party that:

sub-subparagraph.text: was in existence prior to July 1, 1999;
is approved by the Board; and
provides theoretical and practical training relating to natural gas services; and

subparagraph.text: the applicant has acquired 4 years of work experience in providing natural gas services; or

paragraph.text: pass a written examination given by the Board and meet any other requirements specified by the Board, and at a minimum requires:

subparagraph.text: proof of a current master or master restricted heating license in good standing issued by the State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors that is deemed acceptable by the Board; and
2 years of work experience as a journeyman natural gas fitter under the direction of a:

sub-subparagraph.text: licensed master plumber;
licensed master gas fitter; or

holder of a master or master restricted heating license in good standing issued by the State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors, who demonstrates qualification as a natural gas fitter that is deemed acceptable by the Board.

section.text: An applicant for a license shall:

paragraph.text: submit to the Board an application on the form that the Board provides; and
except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, pay to the Board or the Board’s designee an examination fee:

subparagraph.text: for a master plumber license, a journey plumber license, or a master natural gas fitters license, in an amount set by the Board, not to exceed the cost of the required examination;
for an apprentice plumber license or apprentice natural gas fitters license of $15;
for a propane gas fitter certificate of $25;
for a journeyman natural gas fitters license of $25; or
for a master natural gas fitters license without examination of $50.

subsection.text: Except as otherwise provided in § 12-304.1 of this subtitle, an applicant who otherwise qualifies for a license is entitled to be examined as provided in this section.

paragraph.text: Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, the Board shall give examinations to qualified applicants at the times and places that the Board determines.
The Board shall give an examination at least once a year in Baltimore City.

subsection.text: The Board shall give each qualified applicant notice of the time and place of examination.

paragraph.text: The Board shall determine the subjects, scope, and form of and the passing score for examinations given under this subtitle.
The Board shall provide examination questions that test the competency and qualifications of the applicant.
When testing an applicant for a master plumber license or a master natural gas fitters license, the examination given by the Board shall include at a minimum the following areas:

subparagraph.text: gas fitting regulations;
safety regulations;
pipe sizing;
common principles of mathematics and physics relating to gas fitting;
interpretation of plans and drawings showing the arrangement and connection of natural gas pipes, fixtures, or equipment;
design and construction of natural gas systems for buildings; and
venting gas appliances.

paragraph.text: If an applicant fails an examination given by the Board, the Board shall give the applicant notice of the right of the applicant to have the papers of the applicant regraded.
On written request to the Board, an applicant who failed an examination may:

subparagraph.text: review the examination questions and the answers given by the applicant; and
have the examination regraded.

subsection.text: If an applicant fails to appear for a scheduled examination, the Board may require the applicant to pay another examination fee under § 12-303 of this subtitle before rescheduling an examination for the applicant.
The Board may use a testing service to administer an examination given under this subtitle.
If the Board uses a testing service, the testing service, subject to the requirements set by the Board, may:

paragraph.text: set the time and place of examinations;
give qualified applicants notice of the time and place of examinations; and
furnish any other information that the Board may require the testing service to provide.

subsection.text: An examination shall be given at least once per year in Baltimore City.

Subject to the limitations in this section, the Board may waive any of the qualifications for a journey plumber license or a master plumber license for an individual who holds a journey plumber license or a master plumber license issued by Baltimore County or by the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission.
The Board may grant a waiver under this section only if the applicant:

paragraph.text: pays the appropriate license fee required under § 12-306 of this subtitle;
holds a license that is similar to the license for which the applicant is seeking a waiver;
if contracting to provide plumbing services in the name of the applicant or another person, submits proof of the liability insurance as required under § 12-501 of this title; and
provides adequate evidence that the applicant:

subparagraph.text: meets the qualifications otherwise required by this subtitle; and
at the time that the applicant became licensed in Baltimore County or by the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission, the applicant:

sub-subparagraph.text: passed an examination that was given by Baltimore County or the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission and was substantially equivalent to the examination that then was required by the Board; and

met qualifications for licensing that were set by Baltimore County or the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission and were substantially equivalent to the qualifications that then were required by the Board.

paragraph.text: Subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, the Board may grant a waiver of the qualification and examination requirements of § 12-302 of this subtitle only if Baltimore County or the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission waives the qualifications and examination required for individuals licensed by the Board to a similar extent as the Board waives those requirements for individuals licensed by Baltimore County or the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission.

An agreement may be made with Baltimore County that, if an individual who is licensed by the Board as a journey plumber or a master plumber resides in Baltimore County, the individual may be required to pass a licensing examination for a journey plumber or master plumber given by Baltimore County.

subsection.text: Subject to the provisions of this section, the Board may waive the examination requirements for a master plumber license or a journey plumber license for an individual who is licensed to provide plumbing services in another state on the affirmative vote of at least a majority of the authorized membership of the Board.
The Board may grant a waiver under this section only if an applicant:

paragraph.text: pays the appropriate fee required under § 12–306 of this subtitle; and
provides adequate evidence that the applicant:

subparagraph.text: meets the qualifications otherwise required by this title;
holds an active license in good standing in the other state;
holds a license that is equivalent to the State license; and
became licensed in the other state after meeting requirements that are at least equivalent to the licensing requirements of this State.

subsection.text: The Board may grant a waiver only if the state in which the applicant is licensed waives the examination of licensees of this State to a similar extent as this State waives the examination requirements for individuals licensed in that state.

paragraph.text: In this subsection, “BRAC” means the Base Realignment and Closure process as announced by the United States Department of Defense.
Notwithstanding the provisions of subsections (a), (b), and (c) of this section, the Board shall grant a waiver to an applicant who files a request before July 1, 2012, if the applicant:

subparagraph.text: pays the appropriate fee required under § 12–306 of this subtitle;
holds an active Virginia or New Jersey master plumber’s license or an active Virginia journey plumber’s license in good standing that is equivalent to the State license;
has experience in the provision of plumbing services that meets the time requirements of § 12–302 of this subtitle; and
has relocated to the State as a family member of a BRAC employee.

paragraph.text: In this section, “BRAC” means the Base Realignment and Closure process as announced by the United States Department of Defense.

Subject to the provisions of this section, the Board shall waive the examination requirements for a journey natural gas fitters license for an individual who is licensed to provide gas fitting services as a journeyman in Virginia.

subsection.text: The Board shall grant a waiver under this section to an applicant who files a request before July 1, 2012, if the applicant:

paragraph.text: pays the appropriate fee required under § 12–306 of this subtitle;
provides adequate evidence that the applicant:

subparagraph.text: meets the qualifications otherwise required by this title;
holds an active license in good standing in Virginia;
holds a license that is equivalent to the State license; and
has experience in the provision of natural gas services that meets the time requirements of § 12–302 of this subtitle; and

paragraph.text: has relocated to the State as a family member of a BRAC employee.

subsection.text: If an applicant qualifies for a journey plumber license, a master plumber license, a limited license, a master natural gas fitters license, a journeyman natural gas fitters license, an apprentice natural gas fitters license, or a propane gas fitter certificate under this subtitle, the Board shall send the applicant a notice that states that:

paragraph.text: the applicant has qualified for a license; and
the Board will issue a license to the applicant on receipt of:

subparagraph.text: if contracting in the name of the applicant or another person to provide plumbing services, proof of the liability insurance as required under § 12-501 of this title; and
a license fee of:

sub-subparagraph.text: $70 for a master plumber license or a limited master plumber license;
$35 for a journey plumber license or a limited journey plumber license;
$35 for a propane gas fitter certificate;
$70 for a master natural gas fitters license; or
$35 for a journeyman natural gas fitters license.

subsection.text: On payment of the appropriate license fee and, if applicable, receipt of the proof of the insurance required under § 12-501 of this title, the Board shall issue a license to each applicant who meets the requirements of this subtitle.

paragraph.text: Any master plumber, journey plumber, or apprentice holding a valid license is eligible to participate in a Board-approved cross connection/backflow prevention certification program to be certified as an approved cross connection/backflow prevention technician.
Only a master plumber or journey plumber possessing certification shall be authorized to certify the installation and testing of mechanical cross connection control devices.

For the purpose of certification of the installation and testing of mechanical cross connection control devices, a local jurisdiction may adopt regulations or enact laws that have qualifications comparable to or more stringent than paragraph (2) of this subsection.

subsection.text: While a master plumber license is in effect, it authorizes the licensee to provide plumbing services.

While a journey plumber license is in effect, it authorizes the licensee to provide plumbing services only under the direction and control of a master plumber or a holder of a limited master plumber license.

While an apprentice plumber license is in effect, it authorizes the licensee to assist in providing plumbing services only under the direction and control of a master plumber or a holder of a limited master plumber license.

While a propane gas fitter certificate is in effect, it authorizes the certificate holder to provide propane gas services and to directly supervise others in the provision of those services in every political subdivision of the State.
While a master natural gas fitters license is in effect, it authorizes the licensee to provide natural gas services.
While a journeyman natural gas fitters license is in effect, it authorizes the licensee to provide natural gas services only under the direction and control of a licensed master natural gas fitter.
While an apprentice natural gas fitters license is in effect, it authorizes the licensee to provide natural gas service only under the direction and control of a licensed master natural gas fitter.
Subject to § 12–308.1 of this subtitle, unless a license is renewed for a 2–year term as provided in this section, the license expires on the first May 1 that comes:

paragraph.text: after the effective date of the license; and
in an odd–numbered year.

subsection.text: At least 1 month before a license expires, the Board shall mail to the licensee, at the last known address of the licensee:

paragraph.text: a renewal application form; and
a notice that states:

subparagraph.text: the date on which the current license expires;
the date by which the Board must receive the renewal application for the renewal to be issued and mailed before the license expires; and
the amount of the renewal fee.

subsection.text: Before a license expires, the licensee may renew it for an additional 2-year term, if the licensee:

paragraph.text: otherwise is entitled to be licensed;
pays to the Board a renewal fee of:

subparagraph.text: $70 for a master plumber license or a limited master plumber license;
$35 for a journey plumber license or a limited journey plumber license;
$15 for an apprentice plumber license or apprentice natural gas fitters license;
$35 for a propane gas fitter certificate;
$35 for a master natural gas fitters license; or
$25 for a journeyman natural gas fitters license; and

paragraph.text: submits to the Board:

subparagraph.text: if contracting in the name of the licensee or another person to provide plumbing services, proof of the liability insurance required under § 12-501 of this title; and
a renewal application on the form that the Board provides.

subsection.text: The Board shall renew the license of and issue a renewal certificate to each licensee who meets the requirements of this section.
The Secretary may determine that licenses and certificates issued under this subtitle shall expire on a staggered basis.

Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, for an apprentice plumber or apprentice natural gas fitter issued an initial license on or after October 1, 2012, the Board may not renew the license for more than three consecutive terms if the licensee has not taken or registered to take a journey plumber examination or journeyman gas fitters examination.

Notwithstanding subsection (a) of this section, if an apprentice plumber or apprentice natural gas fitter fails a journey plumber examination or journeyman gas fitters examination, the Board shall renew the apprentice plumber license or apprentice natural gas fitters license for an additional 2–year term for each failed examination.
The Board shall reinstate the license of an individual who has failed to renew the license for any reason if the individual:

paragraph.text: applies to the Board for reinstatement within 4 years after the license expires; and
meets the renewal requirements for the appropriate license under § 12-308 of this subtitle.

subsection.text: The Board may not reinstate a journey plumber license, a master plumber license, a limited license, a propane gas fitter certificate, a master natural gas fitters license, a journeyman natural gas fitters license, or an apprentice natural gas fitters license of an individual who for any reason fails to apply for reinstatement within 4 years after the license expired unless the individual:

paragraph.text: meets the renewal requirements for the appropriate license under § 12-308 of this subtitle; and
passes the appropriate examination for obtaining a license under this subtitle.

subsection.text: Subject to the limitations in this section, the Board may issue a limited license to provide plumbing services as a master plumber or a journey plumber to any applicant who:

paragraph.text: meets the qualifications that the Board establishes for:

subparagraph.text: a limited master plumber license; or
a limited journey plumber license;

paragraph.text: passes an examination given by the Board for:

subparagraph.text: a limited master plumber license; or
a limited journey plumber license;

paragraph.text: submits to the Board an application on the form that the Board requires;
pays the appropriate application fee under § 12-303 of this subtitle for:

subparagraph.text: a master plumber license; or
a journey plumber license; and

paragraph.text: if contracting in the name of the applicant or another person to provide plumbing services, submits to the Board proof of the liability insurance as required under § 12-501 of this title.
While a limited master plumber license is in effect, it authorizes the licensee to provide plumbing services only in a specified geographical area of the State.

While a limited journey plumber license is in effect, it authorizes the licensee to provide plumbing services under the direction and control of a master plumber only in a specified geographical area of the State.

subsection.text: A limited license expires on the first May 1 that comes:

paragraph.text: after the effective date of the limited license; and
in an odd-numbered year.

subsection.text: After June 30, 1991, the Board may not issue a limited license to provide plumbing services to any individual.

Notwithstanding subsection (d) of this section, an individual who is issued a limited license to provide plumbing services on or before June 30, 1991, may continue to renew the limited license for a 2-year term as provided under § 12-308 of this subtitle if the individual meets the appropriate renewal requirements for:

paragraph.text: a master plumber license; or
a journey plumber license.

subsection.text: A person who is engaged in the business of providing propane gas services under § 12-401(b) of this title shall meet the insurance requirements set forth in § 12-501 of this title.
A person who holds a master natural gas fitters license and provides natural gas services under § 12-401(c) of this title shall meet the insurance requirements set forth in § 12-501 of this title.

paragraph.text: Each master plumber shall display:

subparagraph.text: the master plumber license and the license number conspicuously in the principal place of business of the master plumber; and
the license number of the master plumber license on each vehicle used on the job for providing plumbing services.

paragraph.text: Each holder of a limited master plumber license shall display:

subparagraph.text: the limited master plumber license and the license number conspicuously in the principal place of business of the holder of the limited master plumber license; and
the license number of the limited master plumber license on each vehicle used on the job for providing plumbing services.

paragraph.text: Each holder of a propane gas fitter certificate shall display:

subparagraph.text: the propane gas fitter certificate and the certificate number conspicuously in the principal place of business of the certificate holder; and
the certificate number of the propane gas fitter certification on each vehicle used on the job in providing propane gas services.

paragraph.text: Each holder of a master natural gas fitters license shall display:

subparagraph.text: the master natural gas fitters license and the license number conspicuously in the principal place of business of the license holder; and
the license number of the master natural gas fitters license on each vehicle used on the job for providing natural gas services.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, a county or municipal corporation may not require a person licensed under this subtitle to display a county or municipal corporation certificate number on each vehicle used on the job for providing plumbing, natural gas fitting, or propane gas fitting services.
This subsection does not apply to Baltimore County or the areas in the State under the jurisdiction of the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission.

subsection.text: Each licensee shall give the Board and any appropriate licensing authority written notice of any change of name, address, or employment from that which appears on the current license, at least 10 working days before the change is to take effect.

paragraph.text: Subject to the hearing provisions of § 12-313 of this subtitle, the Board may deny a license to any applicant, reprimand any licensee, or suspend or revoke a license if the applicant or licensee:

subparagraph.text: fraudulently or deceptively obtains or attempts to obtain a license for the applicant or licensee or for another;
fraudulently or deceptively uses a license;
is guilty of gross negligence, incompetence, or misconduct while providing plumbing services or assisting in providing plumbing services;
is guilty of violating the State Plumbing Code or applicable local plumbing code while providing plumbing services or assisting in providing plumbing services;
under the laws of the United States or of any state, is convicted of:

sub-subparagraph.text: a felony; or
a misdemeanor that is directly related to the fitness and qualification of the applicant or licensee to provide plumbing services;

subparagraph.text: is guilty of an unfair or deceptive trade practice, as defined in § 13-301 of the Commercial Law Article;

fails to train and control adequately any person who, while under the direction and control of the master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license, sells or gives estimates for providing plumbing services or provides or assists in providing plumbing services;

fails to maintain the liability insurance required under § 12-501 of this title for a master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license who contracts to provide plumbing services on behalf of the master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license, or another, holder of a propane gas fitter certificate, or holder of a master natural gas fitters license;
is guilty of violating § 12-605 of this title;

as the holder of a limited license, propane gas fitter certificate, master natural gas fitters license, journey plumber license, journeyman natural gas fitters license, apprentice plumber license, or apprentice natural gas fitters license, performs plumbing, propane gas fitting, or natural gas fitting services outside the scope of that license;
knowingly allows or permits another licensee to perform plumbing, propane gas fitting, or natural gas fitting services outside the scope of that individual’s license;
violates any other provision of this title; or
violates any regulation adopted under this title.
Instead of or in addition to reprimanding a licensee or suspending or revoking a license under this subsection, the Board may impose a penalty not exceeding $5,000 for each violation.
To determine the amount of the penalty imposed under this subsection, the Board shall consider:

sub-subparagraph.text: the seriousness of the violation;
the harm caused by the violation;
the good faith of the licensee; and
any history of previous violations by the licensee.

paragraph.text: The Board shall pay any penalty collected under this subsection into the General Fund of the State.

subsection.text: The Board shall consider the following facts in the granting, denial, renewal, suspension, or revocation of a license or the reprimand of a licensee when an applicant or licensee is convicted of a felony or misdemeanor described in subsection (a)(1)(v) of this section:

paragraph.text: the nature of the crime;
the relationship of the crime to the activities authorized by the license;
with respect to a felony, the relevance of the conviction to the fitness and qualification of the applicant or licensee to provide plumbing services;
the length of time since the conviction; and
the behavior and activities of the applicant or licensee before and after the conviction.

subsection.text: Except as otherwise provided in § 10-226 of the State Government Article, before the Board takes any final action under § 12-312 of this subtitle, it shall give the individual against whom the action is contemplated an opportunity for a hearing before the Board.
The Board shall give notice and hold the hearing in accordance with Title 10, Subtitle 2 of the State Government Article.
The Board may administer oaths in connection with any proceeding under this section.
If, after due notice, the individual against whom the action is contemplated fails or refuses to appear, nevertheless the Board may hear and determine the matter.

section.text: Any person aggrieved by a final decision of the Board in a contested case, as defined in § 10-202 of the State Government Article, may take an appeal as allowed in §§ 10-222 and 10-223 of the State Government Article.

subsection.text: A person may engage in the business of providing plumbing services if:

paragraph.text: the person is a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license; or
the person:

subparagraph.text: designates a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license who actively directs, controls, and is responsible for all plumbing services; and
otherwise provides the plumbing services in accordance with this title.

subsection.text: A person may engage in the business of providing propane gas services if:

paragraph.text: the person is the holder of a propane gas fitter certificate; or
the person:

subparagraph.text: designates a holder of a propane gas fitter certificate who actively directs, controls, and is responsible for all propane gas services; and
otherwise provides the propane gas services in accordance with this title.

subsection.text: A person may engage in the business of providing natural gas services if:

paragraph.text: the person is the holder of a master natural gas fitters license; or
the person:

subparagraph.text: designates a holder of a master natural gas fitters license who actively directs, controls, and is responsible for all natural gas services; and
otherwise provides natural gas services in accordance with this title.

subsection.text: A master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license, or other person who engages in the business of providing plumbing services under this subtitle may employ an individual who is not a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license to provide or assist in providing plumbing services if the individual:

paragraph.text: is licensed:

subparagraph.text: as an apprentice plumber, to assist in providing plumbing services; or
as a journey plumber or holder of a limited journey plumber license, to provide plumbing services; and

paragraph.text: provides or assists in providing the services only within the scope of the license.

subsection.text: This section does not apply to an individual performing work that is only incidental to the licensee providing or assisting in providing plumbing services.

paragraph.text: Before a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license may provide plumbing services through a person who engages in the business of providing plumbing services under this subtitle, a holder of a propane gas fitter certificate may provide propane gas services through a person who engages in the business of providing propane gas services under this subtitle, or a master plumber or a holder of a master natural gas fitters license may provide natural gas services through a person who engages in the business of providing natural gas services under this subtitle, the master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license, holder of a propane gas fitter certificate, or holder of a master natural gas fitters license shall submit to the Board a notice stating the intent of the master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license, holder of a propane gas fitter certificate, or holder of a master natural gas fitters license to do so.
The notice shall include:

subparagraph.text: the name of the master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license, holder of a propane gas fitter certificate, or holder of a master natural gas fitters license submitting the notice;

a statement that the named individual has been designated as the master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license, holder of a propane gas fitter certificate, or holder of a master natural gas fitters license of the person;
the address of the principal place of business of the person;
any trade or fictitious name that the person intends to use while conducting the business of the person;
the name of the person who carries insurance as required under § 12-501 of this title; and
any other information that the Board requires by regulation.

subsection.text: The Board may set by regulation procedures for keeping current information about any person through whom plumbing services are provided.

A master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license may not contract to provide plumbing services on behalf of the master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license, or another person who engages in the business of providing plumbing services unless the plumbing work of the master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license is covered by liability insurance, including completed operations:

paragraph.text: for bodily injury in the amount of at least $300,000; and
for property damage in the amount of at least $100,000.
The insurance required under this section may be bought:

subparagraph.text: by a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license; or

for a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license, by the person who engages in the business of providing plumbing services and employs the master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license.

paragraph.text: The insurance requirement of this section is not met for work that a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license does outside the scope of employment for the person who carries the insurance.

subsection.text: An apprentice plumber, journey plumber, or holder of a limited journey plumber license need not obtain separate insurance while providing or assisting in providing plumbing services within the scope of the license.

paragraph.text: An applicant for a master plumber license or limited master plumber license shall submit proof of the insurance required under this section to the Board with the license application.

The Board may not issue a master plumber license or limited master plumber license to an applicant to whom the insurance requirements of this section would apply unless the applicant submits proof of the insurance.

subsection.text: Unless an applicant meets the insurance requirements of this section, the Board may not renew the master plumber license or limited master plumber license of the applicant to whom the insurance requirements of this section would apply.
A master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license shall give the Board notice of the cancellation of insurance at least 10 days before the effective date of the cancellation.

If a county, municipal corporation, special taxing district, or other political subdivision requires a master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license, or other person who engages in the business of providing plumbing services to execute a surety bond under local plumbing requirements, the person may satisfy the bond requirement by submitting proof of the insurance required under this section.

The Board shall specify on the master plumber license or limited master plumber license whether the master plumber or holder of the limited master plumber license meets the insurance requirements of this section.

Regardless of whether plumbing services are provided for compensation, a person who provides or assists in providing plumbing services shall comply with the State Plumbing Code or any applicable local plumbing code.
To ensure that plumbing services provided in a State building meet or exceed the standards of the State Plumbing Code, the plumbing work shall be inspected:

paragraph.text: to the extent money is provided in the State budget, by a State plumbing inspector; or
if not inspected by a State plumbing inspector, by an inspector of the county or local government where the plumbing services are provided.

subsection.text: Each individual whom the State, a county, or a local government appoints or employs as a plumbing inspector shall:

paragraph.text: each year attend a continuing education course that the Board or, with the approval of the Board, a county or local government conducts; and
meet minimum standards that:

subparagraph.text: adequately ensure that the plumbing inspector is qualified to inspect in accordance with the State Plumbing Code;
are established:

sub-subparagraph.text: by the county or local government in consultation with the Board; or
if there is no standard established by the county or local government, by the Board; and

subparagraph.text: are administered:

sub-subparagraph.text: for a county or local government inspector, by the county or local government that appoints or employs the inspector; and
for a State inspector, by the State.

subsection.text: An individual may not have any financial interest in any plumbing business while employed by the State, a county, or any local government as a plumbing inspector.

paragraph.text: On appointment or employment, the individual shall place the master plumber license, journey plumber license, or limited license on inactive status.
The Board may issue a plumbing inspector identification card to a plumbing inspector who has placed the appropriate license on inactive status.

On termination of the appointment or employment of an individual as a plumbing inspector, the Board shall reactivate the master plumber license, journey plumber license, or limited license of an individual who is on inactive status, without examination, if the individual:

subparagraph.text: makes a written request to the Board; and
pays to the Board a reactivation fee of:

sub-subparagraph.text: $20, for a journey plumber or holder of a limited journey plumber license; or
$50, for a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license.

subsection.text: The Board may impose a reasonable fee to cover the costs of conducting the continuing education courses under subsection (a) of this section.

section.text: Each plumbing advertisement in the name of a person who engages in the business of providing plumbing services shall contain the license number and name of a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license whom the person employs and designates to direct and control the provision of plumbing services through the business of the person.

subsection.text: Except as otherwise provided in this title, a person may not provide, attempt to provide, or offer to provide plumbing services unless licensed by the Board to provide plumbing services.

Except as otherwise provided in this title, a person may not assist, attempt to assist, or offer to assist in providing plumbing services in the State unless licensed by the Board to provide or assist in providing plumbing services.

Except as otherwise provided in this title, a person may not provide, attempt to provide, or offer to provide propane gas services unless licensed by the Board to provide plumbing services or certified by the Board to provide propane gas services.

Except as otherwise provided in this title, a person may not provide, attempt to provide, or offer to provide natural gas services unless licensed by the Board to provide plumbing services or natural gas services.

Except as otherwise provided in this title, a master plumber, holder of a limited master plumber license, or other person who engages in the business of providing plumbing services may not employ an individual to provide or assist in providing plumbing services unless the individual:

paragraph.text: is licensed by the Board as a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license; or

subparagraph.text: is licensed by the Board as a journey plumber, holder of a limited journey plumber license, or apprentice plumber; and
provides or assists in providing the plumbing services within the scope of the license.

subsection.text: A person may not employ an individual to provide or assist in providing plumbing services under a public work contract subject to Title 17, Subtitle 2 of the State Finance and Procurement Article unless the individual is licensed by the Board, the Baltimore County Plumbing Board, or the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission.

A person may not classify an employee under a public work contract subject to Title 17, Subtitle 2 of the State Finance and Procurement Article who is licensed under this title at a specific work classification that is higher than the employee’s license type.

section.text: Except as otherwise provided in this title, regardless of whether a person is engaged in the business of providing plumbing services, the person may not knowingly employ an individual to provide or assist in providing plumbing services in the State unless the individual is licensed by the Board.

Unless authorized under this title to provide plumbing services, a person may not represent to the public, by use of a title, including “master plumber”, “registered plumber”, “licensed master plumber”, “holder of limited master plumber license”, “licensed journey plumber”, “journey plumber”, “holder of a limited journey plumber license”, “holder of a propane gas fitter certificate”, “holder of a master natural gas fitters license”, “holder of a journeyman natural gas fitters license”, or “holder of an apprentice natural gas fitters license”, by description of services, methods, or procedures, or otherwise, that the person is authorized to provide plumbing services in the State.

paragraph.text: A person may not install a plumbing fixture or other device that does not meet the standards for approval as set out in the State Plumbing Code or any applicable local plumbing code.
A person may not sell or install a fixture or other device that does not limit water consumption in accordance with the standards adopted by the Board.

subsection.text: Subject to subsection (c) of this section, each local plumbing inspector shall enforce the prohibition against the installation of a plumbing fixture that is not water-conserving under the State Plumbing Code or any applicable local plumbing code to ensure that the capacity for waste water treatment of municipal sewage treatment facilities and private on-site wastewater disposal systems is not exceeded.
Enforcement of this section may be suspended for a specified period if a local plumbing inspector determines that:

paragraph.text: there is an inadequate supply of fixtures and devices that are required by and meet the standards for approval as set out in the State Plumbing Code or any applicable local plumbing code;

the configuration of a drainage system for a building requires a greater quantity of water to flush the system adequately than is delivered by fixtures and devices that are required by and meet the standards for approval as set out in the State Plumbing Code or any applicable local plumbing code; or
historic restoration would be affected adversely.

subsection.text: In the installation or repair of plumbing intended to dispense water for human consumption, a person shall use only pipes, pipe fittings, plumbing fittings, or fixtures that are lead–free.
In the installation or repair of plumbing intended to dispense water for human consumption, a person shall use only solder or flux that is lead–free.
Only the individual pipes, pipe fittings, plumbing fittings, or fixtures that are installed or repaired may be considered when calculating the weighted average lead content.

A person engaged in the business of selling plumbing supplies in the State may not sell pipes, pipe fittings, plumbing fittings, or fixtures that will be used in the installation or repair of any plumbing that dispenses water for human consumption, unless the pipes, pipe fittings, plumbing fittings, or fixtures are lead–free.

A person engaged in the business of selling plumbing supplies in the State may not sell solder or flux that is not lead–free unless the solder or flux bears a label stating that it is illegal to use the solder or flux in the installation or repair of any plumbing that dispenses water for human consumption.

Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, a person who builds or remodels a building or structure shall ensure installation, in the building or structure, of fixtures and devices that are required by and meet the standards for approval as set out in the State Plumbing Code or any applicable local plumbing code.
Enforcement of this section may be suspended for a specified period if a local plumbing inspector determines that:

paragraph.text: there is an inadequate supply of fixtures and devices that are required by and meet the standards for approval as set out in the State Plumbing Code or any applicable local plumbing code;

the configuration of a drainage system for a building requires a greater quantity of water to flush the system adequately than is delivered by fixtures and devices that are required by and meet the standards for approval as set out in the State Plumbing Code or any applicable local plumbing code; or
historic restoration would be affected adversely.
In this subsection, “officer” includes a superintendent, manager, and agent of a corporation regardless of whether it engages in the business of providing plumbing services.

A person, including an officer, who violates any provision of the following sections of this subtitle is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $50 for each day or part of each day that the violation continues:

subsection.text: A person who violates any provision of the following sections of this subtitle is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $100 or imprisonment not exceeding 6 months or both for each day or part of each day that the violation continues:

Any person who knowingly and willfully violates any provision of § 12-501(a) of this title is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to a fine not exceeding $1,000 or imprisonment not exceeding 6 months or both.

paragraph.text: In addition to any other penalties under this title, the Board may impose on a person who violates any provision of this subtitle a penalty not exceeding $5,000 for each violation.
In setting the amount of the penalty, the Board shall consider:

subparagraph.text: the gravity of the violation;
the good faith of the violator;
the quantity and gravity of previous violations by the same violator;
the harm caused to the complainant, the public, and the plumbing profession;
the assets of the violator; and
any other factors that the Board considers relevant.

section.text: This title may be cited as the “Maryland Plumbing Act”.

Subject to the evaluation and reestablishment provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act, this title and all regulations adopted under this title shall terminate and be of no effect after July 1, 2023.

subsection.text: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.
“Central Repository” means the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services.
“Certification card” means a card issued by the Secretary under § 13-406 of this title to an individual certified as a private detective.
“Firm” means a partnership or corporation.
“Firm member” means a partner of a partnership or an officer or director of a corporation.
“License” means, unless the context requires otherwise, a license issued by the Secretary to conduct a business to provide private detective services.
“Licensed private detective agency” means, unless the context requires otherwise, a person who is licensed by the Secretary to conduct a business that provides private detective services.
“Private detective” means an individual who personally provides private detective services.
“Private detective agency” means a person who conducts a business that provides private detective services.

paragraph.text: “Provide private detective services” means to provide, for compensation, the service of:

subparagraph.text: conducting an investigation that concerns:

sub-subparagraph.text: a crime or wrong committed, assumed to have been committed, or threatened to be committed;
the identity, habits, conduct, movement, location, affiliations, associations, transactions, reputation, or character of any person;
the credibility of a witness or of any other individual;
the location of a missing individual;
the location or recovery of lost or stolen property;
the origin or cause of or responsibility for:

sub-sub-subparagraph.text: a fire;
an accident;
any damage to or loss of property; or
an injury to an individual;

sub-subparagraph.text: the affiliation, connection, or relation of any person with an organization or other person; or
the activities, conduct, efficiency, loyalty, or honesty of any employee, agent, contractor, or subcontractor;

subparagraph.text: securing evidence for use before any investigating committee, board of award, or board of arbitration or for use in the trial of any civil or criminal cause;
nonuniformed personal protection; or
conducting an investigation to locate or apprehend a fugitive from justice, unless the person:

sub-subparagraph.text: conducting the investigation is a property bail bondsman or licensed by the Insurance Commissioner of the State or a similar licensing body of another state as a bail bondsman;
is an employee of a property bail bondsman or a licensed bail bondsman for the purpose of locating or apprehending fugitives from justice; or
is authorized as an agent by a property bail bondsman or licensed bail bondsman in advance of the apprehension of a fugitive from justice.

paragraph.text: “Provide private detective services” does not include:

subparagraph.text: performing any activity of a person who is engaged exclusively in the business of making investigations and reports that relate to the financial standing, creditworthiness, or financial responsibility of any person;

performing any activity of a person who is engaged exclusively in the business of making a report for an insurance or credit purpose, except if the making of the report involves an investigation or surveillance of a sort normally performed by a person who otherwise is subject to this title;
monitoring an electronically controlled burglar or fire alarm system with a central unit; or
making a marketing survey.

subsection.text: “Representative member” means a firm member who is appointed under § 13-302(b) of this title to act on behalf of the firm.
“Secretary” means the Secretary of State Police.

section.text: This title does not apply:

paragraph.text: to an officer or employee of any unit of the United States, of any state, or of any county, municipal corporation, or other political subdivision of any state, while performing a duty of the office or employment;
to a lawyer, while performing any activity that relates to the lawyer’s regular practice of law in the State;
to an individual who, as a regular part-time or full-time employee of a lawyer, provides services that relate to the lawyer’s regular practice of law in the State;

to an individual who is regularly and exclusively employed as an investigator or in any other capacity by a person who is not engaged in the business of providing private detective services, while performing any duty of the employment;

to a person who is licensed to engage in insurance business of any kind in the State, while conducting that business, or to any employee or licensed agent of that person, while conducting that business;
to an independent insurance adjuster, while conducting the business of an insurance adjuster;
to a person while conducting an investigation solely for the person’s own account; or
to a special police officer appointed and while performing under Title 3, Subtitle 3 of the Public Safety Article or § 16-16 of the Code of Public Local Laws of Baltimore City.

section.text: Subject to the provisions of this title, the Secretary is responsible for the licensing of private detective agencies and the regulation of those persons who provide private detective services in the State.

subsection.text: In addition to any powers set forth elsewhere, the Secretary may:

paragraph.text: adopt regulations to carry out this title;
use any member of the Department of State Police, as necessary, to carry out and enforce this title; and
make inquiries and conduct an investigation regarding any applicant:

subparagraph.text: for a license; or
for employment with a licensee as a private detective.

subsection.text: In addition to any duties set forth elsewhere, the Secretary shall:

paragraph.text: adopt regulations that set standards for the certification of employees of private detective agencies as private detectives;
keep a roster of the individuals certified as private detectives under this title, including on the roster:

subparagraph.text: the names of individuals certified;
the name of the licensed private detective agency with or by which each individual is associated or employed; and
any other information that the Secretary considers appropriate; and

paragraph.text: adopt by regulation a schedule of fines for violations of this title that may be assessed by the Secretary under §§ 13-313 and 13-409 of this title.

section.text: The Secretary and all members of the Department of State Police:

paragraph.text: shall treat as confidential any information obtained through an investigation of an applicant for a license or for certification under this title; and

unless required by a court order or subpoena, may not divulge to a person who is not a member of the Department of State Police or a member of any other law enforcement agency that is conducting an official investigation any information obtained through an investigation of an applicant for a license or for certification under this title.

section.text: On the request of the Secretary, the Police Commissioner of Baltimore City shall assist and advise the Secretary regarding the investigation in Baltimore City of any applicant for a license or for certification under this title.
The Secretary shall pay all money collected under this title into the General Fund of the State.

Any person aggrieved by a final decision of the Secretary in a contested case, as defined in § 10-202 of the State Government Article, may take an appeal as allowed in §§ 10-222 and 10-223 of the State Government Article.

subsection.text: Except as otherwise provided in this title, a person shall be licensed by the Secretary as a private detective agency before the person may:

paragraph.text: conduct a business that provides private detective services in the State; and
solicit to engage in a business that provides private detective services in the State.

subsection.text: An individual or a firm may qualify for a license as a private detective agency.
To qualify for a license, an applicant shall meet the requirements of this section.
If the applicant is a firm, the firm shall appoint a firm member as the representative member to make the application on behalf of the firm.

paragraph.text: If the applicant is an individual, the applicant shall be of good character and reputation.
If the applicant is a firm, each firm member shall be of good character and reputation.

subsection.text: The individual applicant or the representative member shall be at least 25 years old.
The applicant shall meet the experience requirements of § 13-303 of this subtitle.
In this section, “organized police agency” means:

paragraph.text: a police department of the State or of a county or municipal corporation of the State;
a private police department that is allowed to enroll its officers in approved Maryland Police Training Commission schools and academies; or
a law enforcement agency of the United States, of any state, or of any county or municipal corporation of any state.

subsection.text: An individual applicant or, if the applicant is a firm, the representative member shall have:

paragraph.text: at least 5 years of experience as a full-time certified or licensed private detective;
at least:

subparagraph.text: 5 years of experience as a full-time police officer with an organized police agency; and
completed successfully a police officer training course that is recognized and approved by the Maryland Police Training Commission;

paragraph.text: at least 3 years of experience in an investigative capacity as a detective while serving as a police officer with an organized police agency;
at least:

subparagraph.text: 3 years of experience in an investigative capacity in any unit of the United States, of the State, or of a county or municipal corporation of the State for the purpose of law enforcement; and
completed successfully the police officer training required by the Maryland Police Training Commission; or

paragraph.text: at least:

subparagraph.text: 5 years of experience as a full-time fire investigator for a fire department or law enforcement agency of the State or of a county or municipal corporation of the State; and
completed successfully the training certified by the Maryland Police Training Commission or the Maryland Fire-Rescue Education and Training Commission.

paragraph.text: An applicant for a license shall:

subparagraph.text: submit to the Secretary an application on the form that the Secretary provides;
submit the documents required under this section; and
pay to the Secretary the fees required under subsection (b) of this section.

paragraph.text: If the applicant is a firm, the representative member shall complete the application form and otherwise be responsible for the firm’s compliance with this section.
An applicant for a license shall pay to the Secretary an application fee of:

subparagraph.text: $200, if the applicant is an individual; or
$375, if the applicant is a firm; and
the fees authorized under subsection (c)(2) of this section.
As part of the application for a license, the applicant shall submit to the Secretary the fingerprints required under subsection (c)(2)(i) of this section.
If the applicant is a firm, the applicant shall pay the cost of the fingerprint card record checks for each firm member.

paragraph.text: The Department of State Police shall apply to the Central Repository for a State and national criminal history records check for each applicant.
As part of the application for a criminal history records check, the Department of State Police shall submit to the Central Repository:

subparagraph.text: two complete sets of the applicant’s legible fingerprints taken on forms approved by the Director of the Central Repository and the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation;
the fee authorized under § 10-221(b)(7) of the Criminal Procedure Article for access to Maryland criminal history records; and
the mandatory processing fee required by the Federal Bureau of Investigation for a national criminal history records check.

paragraph.text: In accordance with §§ 10-201 through 10-234 of the Criminal Procedure Article, the Central Repository shall forward to the applicant and the Department of State Police a printed statement of the applicant’s criminal history record information.

The subject of a criminal history records check under this section may contest the contents of the printed statement issued by the Central Repository as provided in § 10-223 of the Criminal Procedure Article.
If the applicant is an individual, the application form provided by the Secretary shall require:

subparagraph.text: the name of the applicant;
the age of the applicant;
the address of the applicant; and
the current and previous employment of the applicant.

paragraph.text: If the applicant is a firm, the application form provided by the Secretary shall require:

subparagraph.text: a list of all of the firm members; and
for each firm member, the same information required regarding an individual applicant under paragraph (1) of this subsection.

paragraph.text: For all applicants, the application form shall require:

subparagraph.text: the address of the applicant’s proposed principal place of business and of each proposed branch office;
any trade or fictitious name that the applicant intends to use while conducting the business of the private detective agency;
